@@ -95,4 +95,0 @@
-# Allow overriding on the command line
-# (intentionally sharing name with the javac option)
-JAVA_WARNINGS_ARE_ERRORS ?= -Werror
-
@@ -325,1 +321,3 @@
-  $1_OPTIONS += $$(JAVA_WARNINGS_ARE_ERRORS)
+  ifeq ($$(JAVAC_WARNINGS_AS_ERRORS), true)
+    $1_OPTIONS += -Werror
+  endif

@@ -991,0 +991,12 @@
+################################################################################
+#
+# Setup how javac should handle warnings.
+#
+AC_DEFUN([JDKOPT_SETUP_JAVAC_WARNINGS],
+[
+  UTIL_ARG_ENABLE(NAME: javac-warnings-as-errors, DEFAULT: true,
+      RESULT: JAVAC_WARNINGS_AS_ERRORS,
+      DESC: [consider javac warnings to be an error])
+  AC_SUBST(JAVAC_WARNINGS_AS_ERRORS)
+])
+

@@ -267,3 +267,0 @@

-  JAVA_WARNINGS_ARE_ERRORS ?= -Werror
-
@@ -273,1 +270,1 @@
-  $1_FLAGS += -g -Xlint:all $$($1_TARGET_RELEASE) $$(PARANOIA_FLAGS) $$(JAVA_WARNINGS_ARE_ERRORS)
+  $1_FLAGS += -g -Xlint:all $$($1_TARGET_RELEASE) $$(PARANOIA_FLAGS)
@@ -276,0 +273,4 @@
